body_html:
I agree that the subprocess inherits the seed but I am resetting the seed of the subprocess with the seed or all command.
I expect the console output of RETURN TORCH OBJECT and RETURN NONE to be the same because the only difference is that I return a PyTorch object which should not have an influence on the randomization.
body_text:
I agree that the subprocess inherits the seed but I am resetting the seed of the subprocess with the seed or all command.
I expect the console output of RETURN TORCH OBJECT and RETURN NONE to be the same because the only difference is that I return a PyTorch object which should not have an influence on the randomization.
body:
I agree that the subprocess inherits the seed but I am resetting the seed of the subprocess with the `seed` or `all` command.
I expect the console output of `RETURN TORCH OBJECT` and `RETURN NONE` to be the same because the only difference is that I return a PyTorch object which should not have an influence on the randomization.
